title:
Numerical evaluation of two-loop QCD helicity amplitudes for $gg\to t
  \bar{t} g$ at leading colour
authors:
Simon Badger, Matteo Becchetti, Colomba Brancaccio, Heribertus Bayu
  Hartanto, Simone Zoia
abstract:
We present the first benchmark evaluation of the two-loop finite remainders
for the production of a top-quark pair in association with a jet at hadron
colliders in the gluon channel. We work in the leading colour approximation,
and perform the numerical evaluation in the physical phase space. To achieve
this result, we develop a new method for expressing the master integrals in
terms of a (over-complete) basis of special functions that enables the infrared
and ultraviolet poles to be cancelled analytically despite the presence of
elliptic Feynman integrals. The special function basis makes it manifest that
the elliptic functions appear solely in the finite remainder, and can be
evaluated numerically through generalised series expansions. The helicity
amplitudes are constructed using four dimensional projectors combined with
finite-field techniques to perform integration-by-parts reduction, mapping to
special functions and Laurent expansion in the dimensional regularisation
parameter.
